title: Bentley and the P.T.A.
description: A P.T.A. meeting interferes with Bentley Gregg's date plans with a beautiful movie starlet, who is also a very important and valuable client.

title: Bentley Versus the Girl Scouts
description: Uncle Bentley tries to woo his niece Kelly's Pathfinder leader.

title: Uncle Bentley and the Lady Doctor
description: Uncle Bentley resorts to visiting a psychiatrist in order to get Kelly to clean her room.

title: Uncle Bentley and the Aunts
description: After Kelly fails to be voted into the Lucky 13 Club, Uncle Bentley sets outs to find the reason why not.

title: Bentley and the Revolving Housekeepers
description: Uncle Bentley feels that Kelly could benefit from some female supervision, so he hires a lady housekeeper, much to Peter's chagrin.

title: Bentley and the Baby Sitter
description: Kelly's babysitting service turns into a way for available women to meet the most eligible bachelor in Beverly Hills - her Uncle Bentley.

title: Bentley and the Talent Contest
description: Uncle Bentley encourages his reluctant niece to enter the school's talent contest.

title: Bentley, the Homemaker
description: After learning that niece Kelly is becoming attached to another family down the street, Uncle Bentley endeavors to spend more time at home with her. He even arranges a surprise outing with Jack Benny.

title: Bentley and His Junior Image
description: 13-year-old Kelly is going out on her first date, and her Uncle Bentley becomes a bundle of nerves after he learns that the boy is a 15-and-a-half-year-old version of himself.

title: Uncle Bentley Loans Out Peter
description: Bentley lends out Peter to a movie starlet that he's dating. He soon regrets granting her the favor.

title: Bentley and the Social Worker
description: Bentley wants to become Kelly's legal guardian, but because of his bachelor status, he must first undergo an investigation by a social worker.

title: A Sister for Kelly
description: Kelly and Ginger plot to have Uncle Bentley and Ginger's mom meet, fall in love, and get married.

title: Waiting Up for Kelly
description: Bentley and Peter are consumed with worry after Kelly goes missing on a date.

title: Woman of the House
description: Kelly feels that she is now old enough to be treated as the woman-of-the-house. Meanwhile, her girlfriends vote to present a humanitarian award to their heartthrob, Ronnie Burns, the son of George Burns.

title: Peter Falls in Love
description: Spring is in the air, and everyone is falling in love - except Bentley Gregg.

title: Bentley's Prospective Son-In-Law
description: Kelly and her Uncle Bentley meet the irrepressible Howard Meechim.

title: Bentley's Clubhouse
description: All the mothers of Kelly's girlfriends forbid them from continuing to use her home as a hangout because of Uncle Bentley's bachelor status.

title: Uncle Bentley and the Matchmaker
description: The wife of a close friend of Bentley Gregg's secretly plots to trap him into marrying one of her girlfriends.

title: Bentley and the Finishing School
description: Kelly leaves home to attend finishing school.

title: Parent's Night
description: Bentley Gregg has no desire to perform in Kelly's 'Parents Night' play, until he learns that the director and leading lady is a famous beautiful actress.

title: Bentley Leads a Dog's Life
description: Uncle Bentley, Kelly, and Peter are all heading out-of-town in different directions, which results in Jasper heading in the direction of the nearest dog motel.

title: Bentley and the Teenage Siren
description: Kelly is jealous of the new slinky blonde girl at her school, unaware that the feeling is mutual.

title: Bentley & Peter's Teacher
description: Peter begins attending night school.

title: Bentley and the Wedding Bells
description: One of Bentley's important wealthy clients demands that he date her nerdy homely niece.

title: Kelly's Mad Crush
description: Kelly is under the false impression that she is going steady with Ronnie Burns, son of George Burns.

title: Bentley's Big Case
description: Peter goes to court over a fender-bender, and as luck would have it, Bentley Gregg is representing the other side.

title: Bentley's Economy Wave
description: Bentley Gregg decides to tighten the belt, both at home and in the office.

title: Decisions, Decisions
description: It seems that no matter which way Bentley Gregg turns, everyone he knows wants him to make a decision for them.

title: Bentley and the Kleptomaniac
description: Kelly feels Uncle Bentley is spending too much time worrying about her welfare, so she concocts a scheme to make him worry about Howard, instead.

title: A Phone for Kelly
description: Kelly's excessive telephone chattering causes Uncle Bentley to place restrictions on its use, so Kelly schemes to have a second phone installed in her bedroom.

title: Bentley, the Star Maker
description: Uncle Bentley turns Howard into a wildly popular local teenage singing idol.

title: Bentley the Proud Father
description: Uncle Bentley gets involved helping Kelly at her school's fund-raising carnival.

title: Bentley's Aunt Caroline
description: Bentley can't wait for his Aunt Caroline to come visit, and after she arrives, he can't wait for her to leave.

title: Bentley, Man of Steel
description: Bentley is against joining a health and fitness club, until he meets its very attractive owner.

title: Bentley and the Motorcycle
description: Bentley tangles with a young motorcyclist, and much to his chagrin, Kelly unknowingly gets a date with him.

title: Bentley, the Organizer
description: After an upcoming 6-month out-of-town trial unexpectedly settles out of court, Bentley must figure out how to break the 6-month lease of his home he made in anticipation of the trip. Worse than that, the tenants have already moved in.

title: Bentley and the Beauty Contest
description: Bentley's unscrupulous friend, Chuck, wants him to help throw the judging of a beauty pageant.

title: Bentley, the Hero
description: An aspiring young actress fakes a drowning in order to meet her rescuer: entertainment lawyer Bentley Gregg.

title: Peter Meets His Match
description: Bentley coaches Peter in winning the heart of the woman he loves.

title: Bentley and the Dog Trainer
description: Jasper has been stealing and hiding items around the house, and after Bentley is sued for a neighbor's garden damage, he sends Jasper to dog obedience training school.

title: Bentley and the Gullible Guitarist
description: Kelly manipulates Uncle Bentley, Peter, and Howard into providing money, food, and entertainment for a party she's planning. She soon learns what goes around comes around.

title: Kelly's Idol
description: Kelly tries to mold her new flame in the form of her beloved Uncle Bentley.

title: East Meets West
description: Peter is addicted to his favorite TV western show starring Rock Randall, a client of Mr. Gregg. Peter threatens to quit unless Mr. Gregg buys a TV that he can watch in the kitchen while he cooks.

title: Bentley and Grandpa Ling
description: Peter introduces Kelly and Uncle Bentley to the inimitable Grandpa Ling. If he sees something he likes, he takes it and leaves an item that he thinks is of equal value in its place.

title: Kelly: The Golddigger
description: Kelly starts dating a rich boy, and all she cares about is his money. Uncle Bentley plots to set her straight.

title: The Rescue of Rufus
description: Bentley Gregg takes the case of a canine client named Rufus, after a little boy's dog is accused of biting a man, who demands that Rufus be destroyed.

title: A Key for Kelly
description: Kelly pleads with Uncle Bentley that she's almost sixteen and now old enough to have her own house key.

title: Bentley's Double Play
description: Uncle Bentley unwillingly becomes involved with directing two plays: one featuring Kelly and the other featuring Peter.

title: Bentley and the Brainy Beauty
description: Tired of dating dumb blondes, Bentley starts going out with a smart attractive female attorney.

title: Bentley Plays Cupid
description: Bentley tries to trick his bachelor friend, Chuck, into marrying his lovelorn secretary, Kitty.

title: Kelly's Secret
description: Bentley Gregg goes on a detective mission to find out the identity of the person in Kelly's class who is getting married. He assumes it's a student, but what Kelly won't tell him is that it's actually her teacher.

title: Bentley Goes to Washington
description: Bentley is being lured to join a prestigious law firm in Washington, DC. Of course, none of his friends and family want him to move.

title: Kelly, the Politician
description: It's rough and tumble politics, as Kelly campaigns to be elected president of the student council.

title: Bentley: The Gentleman Farmer
description: Bentley decides to take harsh measures against a gopher that is stealing his backyard grown tomatoes.

title: Bentley and the Combo
description: Bentley suffers the trials and tribulations of helping a small jazz combo from Kelly's high school rehearse for a Battle Of The Bands contest. Their new pushy young sax player becomes the bane of everyone's existence - especially Bentley's.

title: Bentley and the Bartered Bride
description: Peter barters for a lovely young bride set up by 'Cousin' Charlie.

title: The Blonde Issue
description: After Uncle Bentley says absolutely not to Kelly's request to dye her hair blonde, she makes a bet with him that if there's evidence that his redheaded girlfriend dyes her hair, then Kelly can dye hers, too.

title: Bentley and the Majorette
description: Bentley encourages one of Kelly's friends to enter a majorette contest.

title: Bentley, the Model Citizen
description: Bentley is a member of the City Planning Committee, and as such, it has put him at odds with a couple neighbors. Whether or not to install a new traffic light is the problem.

title: The Fishing Trip
description: Kelly thinks that Uncle Bentley wishes he had a son, so she offers to go on a camping trip with him and his friends and their cute teenage sons.

title: The Fortune Cookie Caper
description: Against Mr. Gregg's advice, Peter, with the help of Kelly, Ginger, and Howard, goes into business making and selling homemade fortune cookies. The bureaucratic red tape that Peter encounters takes up so much of Mr. Gregg's time that it jeopardizes a million-dollar deal at his law office.

title: Kelly and the College Man
description: 16-year-old Kelly gets in over her head after lying about her age to a 22-year-old college man because she wants to date him. She tells him that she's 19, and surprisingly, she gets Uncle Bentley to back up her lie.

title: Kelly: The Career Woman
description: There's disorder in the court when Kelly becomes Uncle Bentley's "junior partner".

title: Bentley's New House
description: Bentley Gregg reminisces about the ups and downs of moving into his family's new house.

title: Bentley, the Stage Mother
description: Kelly wants to break into acting, and Uncle Bentley gets a little bit too involved.

title: The Woman's Angle
description: Kelly is tired of being excluded from adult matters, so Uncle Bentley allows her to substitute for his secretary on her day off. Kelly quickly becomes overwhelmed by the tasks at hand.

title: Bentley Meets the Perfect Woman
description: Bentley begins dating an efficiency expert.

title: Bentley and the Travel Agent
description: Bentley's latest attraction is a lovely young lady working at her father's travel agency. In order to ingratiate himself with them, he drums up business.

title: The Very Friendly Witness
description: Uncle Bentley and Kelly both decide to go steady at the same time. It's not easy for either of them.

title: Bentley and the Blood Bank
description: Frank Curtis tells a phony story about Bentley being a World War II hero, and a pretty young nurse at the Red Cross agrees to go out with him, only because she believes it.

title: A Man of Importance
description: After several ego-shattering blows, Peter's feeling of self-importance is at an all-time low. He threatens to quit and move to San Francisco - and this time he means it.

title: Bentley and the Beach Bum
description: Kelly has fallen for a beach bum, and Uncle Bentley intends to do something about it.

title: Where There's a Will
description: Mystery and intrigue abound when Bentley Gregg assembles an odd cast of characters to attend the reading of the last will and testament of a rich relative.

title: Bentley's Birthday Gift
description: Kelly plans to surprise her Uncle Bentley on his birthday, but her scheme goes awry.

title: Jasper the Second
description: Jasper, the family dog, dies at age 14, and Uncle Bentley is dead set against adopting a new one.

title: Kelly Learns to Drive
description: It's time for Kelly to learn how to drive, and her Uncle Bentley is a bundle of nerves.

title: Trial Separation
description: After a disagreement with Mr. Gregg, Peter questions their compatibility and decides that it's best to have a week-long trial separation.

title: Mystery Witness
description: Bentley Gregg attempts to get an unwilling and shady witness to testify on behalf of his niece, Kelly, after she is rear-ended in a traffic accident. The other driver claims that it's all Kelly's fault.

title: A Crush on Bentley
description: The daughter of one of Bentley Gregg's clients develops a crush on him.

title: Peter Gets Jury Notice
description: Peter views his jury notice as an opportunity to impress his new girlfriend, so he invites her to court to watch him in action. When he's finally chosen, he is humiliated by being kicked off the jury because Mr. Gregg is one of the lawyers.

title: Hilda the Jewel
description: Hilda the Jewel turns out to be more like Hilda the Horrible, when Bentley Gregg temporarily takes in a vacationing friend's overbearing housemaid to help Peter.

title: It Happens in November
description: When a pretty election board supervisor needs help, it's Bentley to the rescue. He offers to convert his living room into a polling precinct on election day.

title: How to Catch a Man
description: Bentley's latest fling gives advice to Kelly on the finer points of trapping a boy.

title: Kelly, the Matchmaker
description: Kelly meddles in the love life of others, which turns everyone's life upside down.

title: Bentley Cracks the Whip
description: Bentley pulls the purse strings and puts the entire household on a strict weekly budget. His timing couldn't have been worse.

title: Bentley and the Big Board
description: Following Bentley's advice, Peter and Kelly each buy one share of stock in Sutton Industries. When the stock price promptly falls, things get ugly.

title: Dear Bentley
description: Kelly gets her very own teenage advice column in the school paper.

title: Bentley and the Lost Chord
description: One of Mr. Gregg's clients needs an original theme song for a new sci-fi series. When he hears Peter humming an original tune while vacuuming, he asks for him to record it. Unfortunately, Peter soon forgets the melody.

title: Ginger's Big Romance
description: Ginger has an eye for David; David has an eye for Kelly; and Uncle Bentley has both eyes on everyone.

title: Bentley and the Woodpecker
description: A noisy woodpecker is keeping Bentley up at night. He may have to take drastic measures to get rid of it.

title: Bentley Goes to Europe
description: Peter has an opportunity to go with Mr. Gregg and Kelly on a free trip to Italy, but first he has to prove he's a United States citizen in order to obtain a passport. Easier said than done.

title: The Greggs in Rome
description: Acting on behalf of a client, Bentley pressures an Italian director to complete a motion picture.

title: The Greggs in London
description: The Gregg's visit London, and Peter butts heads with a butler.

title: Encore in Paris
description: Bentley, Kelly, and Peter all get bitten by the love bug, while in Paris.

title: There's No Place Like Home
description: The Gregg household has returned from Europe, and they are boring everyone with their photos, home movies, and tales about their trip across The Pond.

title: Bentley Swims Upstream
description: Howard and Kelly try their hand at writing a jingle for the salmon industry.

title: A Man Among Men
description: Kelly has fallen for the star high school basketball center, much to Howard's dismay.

title: Peter's China Doll
description: Peter wins a 7-year-old girl in a poker game and wants to adopt her, even if it means getting married.

title: Bentley and the Counterspy
description: Howard volunteers for the Army, and he asks Kelly if she'll wait for him.

title: Bentley and the Great Debate
description: A stuttering, bumbling student takes on the president of the school's debating team.

title: Bentley and the Nature Girl
description: Bentley has his eye on a bird watcher.

title: Bentley's Mad Friends
description: Bentley, Kelly, and Peter enter into a pact not to get angry.

title: Hilda Rides Again
description: Bentley plays matchmaker when Hilda the maid returns to the Gregg household.

title: Kelly's Charge Account
description: Uncle Bentley allows Kelly to open a personal charge account. It doesn't take long before she becomes a personal loan company to all of her girlfriends.

title: Bentley Builds a Pool
description: Bentley's neighbor, Cal, is sick of being bothered by all of Ginger's friends hanging around their swimming pool, so he slyly convinces Bentley into building a backyard pool of his own.

title: Bentley Slays a Dragon
description: Peter lets power go to his head after he becomes chairman of the building committee for the Purple Dragon Lodge.

title: A Favor for Bentley
description: Kelly asks Uncle Bentley for a favor, which leads to a chain of favors made by several people, each favor being dependent on the other being kept. This house of cards is bound to collapse.

title: Kelly Gets a Job
description: After Uncle Bentley refuses to buy a new formal gown for Kelly to wear to a college fraternity dance, she gets a job as a teen fashion model to earn money for a new dress.

title: Kelly's Tangled Web
description: Bentley finds Kelly lying to one boy to get out of a date, so she can go out with another boy. She's forbidden to go, and a firm rule is established about strict truth telling-until he's found having to juggle similar lies with clients.

title: Bentley's Barbecue
description: Backyard battles begin: Bentley's barbecue pit versus Cal's sprinkler system.

title: Drop That Calorie
description: Kelly, Peter, and Uncle Bentley all go on a diet and exercise program to lose weight. Which one of them will cave in first?

title: Kelly's Graduation
description: Uncle Bentley meddles in Kelly's high school graduation day and future college plans.

title: Kelly and the Freethinker
description: Kelly develops a crush on a young philosopher, who is full of hot air.

title: Never Steal an Owl
description: A college prank gone wrong lands Howard in court, and Bentley Gregg must defend him against theft and arson charges.

title: Bentley's Catered Affair
description: Kelly, Howard, and Peter go into the food catering business. Too bad it's in violation of residential zoning laws.

title: The House at Smuggler's Cove
description: Bentley Gregg investigates a claim that one of his client's houses is haunted, thereby greatly depressing its value.

title: Peter's Punctured Wedding
description: Due to an old Chinese family contract entered into by Peter's parents when he was born, he must marry a certain young woman who is now old enough to wed. This means that he must quit his job as houseboy.

title: Star Light, Star Not So Bright
Bentley and the Timeclock
description: Cousin Chalie's latest scheme is the BSCH - the Benevolent Society of Chinese Houseboys, which in turn forces Bentely Gregg to put Peter on a time clock.

title: The Law and Kelly Gregg
description: After passing an aptitude test that states she would make a good journalist, Kelly spends a day shadowing Uncle Bentley at his law office to come up with an article for her school paper.

title: Kelly the Yes Man
description: To win popularity and votes when she's placed on the ballot for class vice-president, Kelly volunteers Peter's cooking and a visit from one of Bentley's movie star clients at a school party.

title: Gold in Them Hills
description: Peter purchases five acres of land in an abandoned gold prospecting town.

title: How Howard Won His C
description: Howard wants to impress Kelly by earning a school sports letter for his sweater, so he tries out for the fencing team.

title: Pinch That Penny
description: Bentley Gregg subcontracts the butler services of Rochester, while Jack Benny is away on vacation. He hopes that he can teach Peter to be more economical.

title: Will Success Spoil Jasper?
description: Jasper's couch-jumping lands him in the doghouse, until he becomes top dog by getting a job doing it in show business.

title: Strictly Business
description: Bentley Gregg scrambles to cover his butt after he receives notice of a scheduled interview with the Internal Revenue Service.

title: On the Old Camp Ground
description: To convince Kelly, Ginger and Mrs. Mitchell that camping out would be fun, Bentley, Cal and Peter challenge them to spend a few nights in sleeping bags in the Gregg backyard. They agree to this, but scheme to get out of it.

title: A Visit to the Bergens
description: Peter quits and goes to work for ventriloquist

title: The Richest Cat
description: Bentley and his neighbor, Cal, feud over the rights to a cat that is heir to a million-dollar fortune.

title: The Twain Shall Meet
description: Kelly arranges a clandestine meeting of a Chinese teenage girl with a Chinese teenage boy, whom her father forbids her to see.

title: Bentley Goes to Bat
description: Bentley Gregg is assigned the task of taking the tomboy out of a Los Angeles Dodgers third-base coach's doting daughter.

title: Kelly's Engagement
description: Kelly receives a proposal of marriage from a young new attorney, whom her Uncle Bentley suspects is merely trying to further his legal career by joining his law office.

title: Kelly, the Home Executive
description: Not only is Kelly going to meet her fiancé's parents, she's cooking dinner for them, and she's a bundle of nerves.

title: What Men Don't Know
description: Kelly is feeling that she is intellectually inadequate for her lawyer-fiancé, so Uncle Bentley coaches her in the finer points of deceiving a man.

title: Bentley Takes It Easy
description: With Kelly's encouragement, Uncle Bentley decides to take a week off from his law practice and spend it relaxing at home. Unfortunately for Kelly, Peter, and Julio the gardener, he becomes an unbearable fussbudget around the house.

title: Boys Will Be
description: Bentley is talked into organizing activities for a group of boys who are in and out of trouble with the law. All seems to go well until a judge's prized golf trophy is stolen.

title: Peter, the Medicine Man
description: Peter wants to be just like his favorite TV character: Dr. Bart Bellamy, M.D.

title: Curfew Shall Not Ring Tonight
description: Kelly and Ginger move away from home and into a college boarding house, which is ruled by a strict housemother.
